Type.Name: TypeLoadException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable beforefieldinit TypeLoadException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when the system cannot load a .

remarks.para:
is thrown when the system cannot load a , or cannot locate the assembly that contains the

block.para: The following CIL instructions throw and set the TypeName property via some unspecified mechanism:

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "A failure has occurred while loading a type." This message takes into account the current system culture.

.property string Message { public hidebysig virtual specialname string get_Message() }

summary.para: Gets the error message for this exception.

value.para: A containing a message that describes the error.

remarks.para: If no message was supplied to the constructor for the current instance, the system supplies a default message that is formatted using the current system culture. The system-supplied message includes the fully qualified name of the type that failed to load, and the string obtained by invoking on the assembly that referenced the type. For a type named , referenced by an assembly with the simple name , the message might read as follows:

para.c: Could not load type MyTypes.MyClass from assembly MyAssembly, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null.

summary.para: Gets the fully qualified name of the that failed to load.

value.para: A containing the fully qualified type name.
